main event: A UFO was observed falling straight down in Topeka, Kansas on February 19, 1953.
interesting points: The object was reported to have a comet-like appearance with an orange flame and a tail four times the diameter of the object., The object appeared to disintegrate and was observed for about 3 minutes., The sighting was reported by a civilian driving in a car., No aircraft were reported in the area at the time of the sighting., There is speculation that the object could have been an accidental drifting satellite or weather balloon.
sighted object: comet-like falling object with orange flame
witness description: a civilian observer driving a car
